column16:
Use #T8_claudio
to share tech about this character on Twitter

column2:
Can perform Starburst moves at any time
during Heat.
column7:
Very damaging high attack you can use for approaching 
 and pressuring opponents. Be careful not to become too 
 predictable with it, though.

column17:
granted after hitting
opponnents with 
certain moves

column7:
A plus on block mid heat engager. Avoid using it against 
 opponents that sidestep a lot, as this move is very linear.

Useful in combos and against players that like to challenge 
 2,1 on block.

A long range mid/mid heat engager. Great whiff punisher 
 especially during heat as the heat dash version launches.
Single jab to check situations and start your offense.

Your fastest mid poke. Use the b+3,n,3 extension against 
 opponents that often challenge the first hit on block. 
 This move is a knee, so it's a good option to freely poke 
 characters with normal parries and reversals.

column2:
uf+3
CH f+4
CH sidestep 4
heat on 3,2~F

column7: An unsafe but fast mid counterhit launcher.

Extremely strong homing mid. Use this to control the space 
 in the midrange and at the wall to score a wallsplat.

Low poke out of sidestep to harass opponents and start 
 his pressure.

Safe mid approach to punish opponents for trying to duck 
 your f,f,f+2 approach.

Mostly useful for hitting opponents on the ground. During 
 Starburst, it becomes a safe and very evasive mid launcher.

Quick mid attack with a lot of range and two extremely 
 delayable follow-ups. df+3,1 is especially strong near the wall 
 since you can situation confirm it into a wallsplat.

column12:
After tornado, you can follow with ws+1 into a Heat Burst
Finish with f,f,f+2~F into 3+4 if you want to spend
your meter for damage.

After tornado, you can use df+3,1 for long wall carry and
uf+3+4 for short distances. For the tornado launchers
change the ender to b+4,1 or b+4,3 to get a cleaner wall splat.

In combos, you can use 3+4 to floor break and
f,f,f+2 or d+1+2 to break walls.
